name: donsoze
text: I've always wondered what Mr. Bear's gift was.

text: http://achewood.com/shop/books_vol1.php

text: (now at http://www.achewoodshop.com/1010.html)

name: atticusonline
text: [IMGS OFF]

name: nyu
text: A comment left by nyu was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Nurdbot, farqussus, mrn, jmmfgd, I_Love_Kate)

name: imitationcrab
text: what's a stomper?

name: digdugz
text: A Construction Vehicle.

name: mattylite
text:
[url]http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uWtpYhWEzp8&feature=related[?url]
But maybe it was some stream of consciousness from the last strip via this: http://www.lysator.liu.se/~zap/stomper/index2.html

name: deimosrising
text: This strip is historic for more than just being the first actually funny strip; it is also the first appearance of the phrase "a momentary diversion on the road to the grave."

name: stilted
text: Yeah, rereading these, it is surprising how early the phrase shows up.

name: semiquaver
text: You realize this is the second strip right

name: i_love_kate
text: You realise that this is the only instance in which this phrase appears right.

name: tekende
text: You realize that everyone you know someday will die right

name: gunsofray
text: SHUT UP SHUT UP SHUT UP. they.. can't die... nonono ..

name: dracer2
text: You realize that the sun doesn't go down, it's just an illusion caused by the earth spinning round, right?

name: ambala
text: I love that two strips in, we have a pretty clear idea of Phillipe's role in the Onstad household.

name: billyamericana
text: Why does Cornelius have a toy truck?

name: zefiel
text: Cornelius is OLD SCHOOL.

name: jawsh
text:
Damn, man! Yes!
Yes! Old School!
Old School!

name: wjon
text:
Old school; new school; even in-between school...

What are you going to do when you get out of law school?

name: superleahjane
text: Connie is pre-Ray Ray...

name: kledermans
text: He may keep it for the same reason as he keeps [kept] his childhood drum.  Or it may not matter since this is still kind of proto-Cornelius as we know him now.

name: greyfield
text: Because of a problem?

name: amberjunk
text: Because of a problem? Haha.  I love Phillipe

name: mortshire
text: i used to regift other people's stuff all the time as a kid...oh, philippe, you make me regret my wasted childhood and resent your perpetual one.

name: the_jon
text: A comment left by the_jon was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by ImitationCrab, mikeronomicon, Jesler729, Deusoma, eric, equinn2006, Sargasm, DirtyAntaeus, PohlHoud, Jeef, sncether, alejandroadam, Epicurus, turnabout, holly_golightly, mrn, dj)

name: alejandroadam
text: dood it's a comic strip. the medium give it that nature.

name: epicurus
text: Personally I started at the beginning as well, but the difference is that I will admit the first ones are not nearly as "good" as the later ones (on average) instead of using a weird analogy and spelling a word with zeroes.

name: a_dude
text: Cornelius Bear has changed since this strip. the change has been Capital!

name: deadaluspark
text: this makes me laugh despite still not knowing what the hell phillipes "problem" is

name: twohundredninety
text: It makes me laugh because I don't know what the problem is.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: or what sort of problem it could be.

name: tombsgrave
text: Phillipe's little flipperarm in the first two panels is just adorable.

name: u235
text: I think his arms are supposed to be behind his back, as he hides his gift (and his problem) from view.

name: max
text: Such the good answer to that question. I see that. Mmmmmhmmm.

name: curdledboy
text: A grim, meat-hook philosophy. Brutal, apt, oddly touching. Words we can all live by...

name: tellumo
text: "Because of a . . . problem?" is a good (and possibly the best) answer to any "why" question.

name: hellofditties
text: "Because of a reason" is also a good reply.

name: kickstart
text: I've used it =)

name: nerd_specs
text: Except when the question is directed at your boss and is, "Why didn't I get my paycheck?" That was the answer I got, and I will tell you that I was not amused. Well, maybe a little.

name: kamet
text: But only because of the awesome Achewood reference? ;)

name: riazm
text: I find myself having to ask "Why is it wet?" Altogether more than I would like

name: fineoakstructure
text: I always thought it wasn't so vague.  I figured it Philippe is incontinent; we learn later that he has a bed wetting problem, so I think it fits?

name: gournal
text:
That reminds me of a "wet" story I know...

At Bonnaroo my friend was obviously doing drugs and she had a wet blanket wrapped all around her body as we walked through a tightly packed crowd. The following is the conversation that happened when she bumped into a woman, touching her with the soggy blanket:

"What are you wet with??"
"Blanket."
"Yeah well, what is IT wet with?"
"Love."

name: petestart
text: The middle frame is the key here. Not merely because of the seminal phrase uttered by Mr Bear, but also because it speaks to the ultimate and enduring relationship that he and the otter share to this day.

name: brzbee
text: God, i love this strip... i first started reading the archives at The Party,so i missed out on the dada-ist humor of the first few strips.

name: sminniha
text: Can someone help me?  Why is "momentary diversion on the road to the grave" such a famous line?  I mean i love achewood, and i've read it in its entirety at least 3 times, and there are many other hilarious lines.  why is this so famous?

name: echidnaboy
text: Because it's on a t-shirt?

name: phthoggos
text: Because of a problem?

name: u235
text: Yes. That problem is mortality.

name: rowboat
text: If you have to ask, you'll never know.

name: onepapertiger
text: I never ever thought I would find anyone else quoting this freely. Yet here you are, singing in a back-up chorus for The Man with a Sock on his Cock.

name: rowboat
text: Well, it's actually a Louis Armstrong quote, but I ain't sayin' I never owned Blood Sugar Sex Magik, 'cause I did, indeed.

name: joeyramoney
text: A comment left by joeyramoney was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by FVVS, EM2, rowboat, catgrl131, morypcaina, Tagrineth, MarkRowe)

name: morypcaina
text: "Because of a problem?" is hilarious.

name: em2
text: Yes! And so "is a momentary diversion on the road to the grave."

name: mystkmanat
text: Funny because it's true.

name: thegrouch
text: I don't know why the first strip is rated higher than this one.  Nostalgia and sentiment is interfering with your objectivity, people!

name: susurrus
text: y'know, i shied away from achewood at first because i found the art too simplistic, and the humor... dumb... but then, i stuck with it for a while and grew to love it.  i find when i go back and read the earlier strips, i "get" it better somehow.  part of it is because i know the characters so well, but the other part of it illudes me.  i have the feeling that this is similar to a lot of readers, so i don't think it's just nostalgia.

name: nyu
text: no one cares, dude. Really. No one.

name: zapatos
text: It is just some dudes who are living their life, that is always good to see.  Unless their lives are shit, aka: Pat.  What am I saying, I love reading about Pat.

name: vice
text: Would be a 3, but Cornelius's "Just a momentary diversion" comment bumps it to a 4

name: boots
text: This was the first strip i saw, it's had me hooked ever since

name: rowboat
text:
Oh, I get it, boots! It's your awesome idea to post this exact sentence on every single strip! Dude, that is so funny! You're totally getting inside my head!

Which reminds me: who does a guy have to blow to get spam-marking privileges around here? I think I've earned them by now. Meanwhile, those of you who do have them, go to work on this phony account, please. It is a waste of space. Thanks.

name: twoheadedboy
text: This is one of my all-time favorites. I truly don't understand why it isn't rated higher.

name: altffour
text: I agree with the hell out of you. The second panel rules, and "because of a problem?" is one of my favorite achewood lines ever.

name: daidai
text: Why don't people like this one more? It's got 2 brilliant one-liners.

name: mattylite
text: Wow, like 900 strips later I was reading Philippe's blog and "because of a problem" reappeared. Then I remembered it from this comic. Now I am telling everyone about it.

name: gladi8orrex
text: A comment left by gladi8orrex was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by diggydow, dj_insomniac, tellumo)

name: radarjammer
text: Cornelius is way too sophisticated for the underground.

name: wonelove
text: Phillipe doesn't know why the stomper is wet, either

name: sparhawk
text: The childhood drum, at least, was not covered in problem.

name: wonglers
text: You guys are reading into this [i]way[i] too much.  The problem is that he got the stomper wet.

name: wonglers
text: I guess I [i]don't[i] know how to use BBcode.

name: bmsfbezjovtf
text: this is the first achewood strip i saw, it had me hooked ever since

name: mikeronomicon
text: When I was a child, I could only hope to be as cute as Phillipe. But I wasn't.

name: mikeronomicon
text: Come to think of it, I probably never will be either, but then again, I don't think I want to be a perpetually 5 year old river otter either. Wait a minute.............

name: rodjmeister
text: Oh Philippe. you are so silly.

name: imstandingonit
text:
This was my first Achewood comic ever!

Hilarious!

name: hobit
text: this stripe embodies what i love about achewood

name: mensch
text: Hot . . . Wet . . . Otter!

name: gladi8orrex
text:
[IMGS OFF]

test 1

name: puguglypress
text: omg

name: mrchuckletrouzd
text: freedom of speech

name: greenkoolayd
text: otters have paws.  i dont get why philippe has flippers, instead....

name: cpnglxynchos
text: because of a problem?

name: greenkoolayd
text: it is unpleasant to think of such a young otter with such an extreme problem....

name: taskmaster
text: I lot of otters his age have problems. I think its time we as a species accepted that otters are pleauged with problems. That happy, playful exterior isn't fooling anyone.

name: greenkoolayd
text: im going to pretend that otters cold have dream-lives full of happiness and food and sex.  consider your supposed reality rejected.

name: bluemoon72
text: No need to pretend... it is the truth.

name: greenkoolayd
text: so does that mean that taskmaster is lying, or what?

name: taskmaster
text: Maybe I've just met some bad otters, man. You know- otters with "troubles". Maybe they've seen some freaky shit. Who knows if an otter could cope?

name: greenkoolayd
text: im going to indulge the realistic parts of my sensibilities and agree with you.

name: supahlovah
text: LOL. This was funny in ways I never noticed my first time through.

name: carlyle
text: For the first two panels it looks like Phillipe only has the one arm, folks!
